text: Morgan Bonaparte "Bone" Mizell (1863–1921) was a Floridian cattle herder, and one of the early Florida frontiersmen known as Florida crackers. Mizell was known for his mischievous antics, and was regarded as a fun-loving and hard- drinking entertainer. He had an impressive physical appearance, standing six feet tall with a "protruding chin" and "hawk-like nose". Frederic Remington painted him. ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:Cowboys Category:Florida cracker culture Category:1863 births Category:1921 deaths
title: Bone Mizell
